newsitem.title: USA: TransTexas expects Q4 profit vs loss.
newsitem.headline: TransTexas expects Q4 profit vs loss.

text.p: TransTexas Gas Corp said on Wednesday it expected to post a profit in the fourth quarter ending January 31.
Simon Ward, a company spokesman, said TransTexas expected "to report improved earnings in its fourth fiscal quarter," citing increased production and higher natural gas prices.
TransTexas lost $0.17 per share, including a hedging loss of $0.09 per share, in the January 1996 quarter, which was the second quarter of a six-month transition period.
The First Call consensus estimate for the fourth quarter ending January 31, 1997, is earnings of $0.12 per share.

Ward declined comment on the fourth-quarter First Call estimate. But he said the consensus forecast of a third-quarter loss of $0.10 per share was "pretty accurate." He said the company would report third-quarter results in early to mid-December.
Ward also said the price TransTexas received for spot natural gas was more than $3 per million Btu Wednesday and has remained more than $2.50 per million on all sales since the beginning of November.
He said one presale deal for delivery next month fetched $3.45 per million Btu.
Ward said about 50 percent of the company's volumes are subject to spot-market and indexed pricing, explaining the indexed prices are done on a weekly or monthly basis to reflect spot pricing.
Since the beginning of its third quarter on August 1, the company said, its total gross production capacity has increased 45 percent to 750 million cubic feet per day.
That results in a net production of about 535 million cubic feet a day, Ward said.
